moves.1. e4 e5 2. Nf3 Nf6: After many years playing the Philidor's Defense, I decided on the Petroff.
moves.3. Nxe5 d6 4. Nf3 Nxe4 5. d3 Nf6 6. Nc3: I saw this pawn push in an opening book and thought it was quite interesting
moves.7. Bg5 Bb4: Black acts quickly to keep the tension on the board and not falling to passivity
moves.8. a3 Bxc3+ 9. bxc3: I sacrificed my Bishop pair hoping to get some attack going at the queenside later in the game
moves.9... O-O 10. Be2 h6 11. Be3: If 11.Bxf6 Qxf6, White loses the initiative by having to defend the c3 pawn
moves.11... b6 12. O-O c5: Up to this point, most of the moves had been the computer's first choice and the game is close to equal.
moves.13. Rb1:
13. Rb1? 
After moves like Nc6 and Re8, Black would slowly gain some space.
moves.13... Bb7:
13...Bb7??
Careless mistake. I missed that the b6 pawn was pinned and proceeded to lose a pawn with no compensation whatsoever.
moves.14. Bxc5 bxc5 15. Rxb7 Qa5:
15. ...Qa5?!
I had second thoughts about this move. Maybe Nc6 should've been first followed by Qa5 but things are not so clear.
moves.16. Qa1 Re8 17. Re1 Nbd7 18. Rbb1: Now this is close to equality despite a pawn down. White might have maintained some pressure with 18 c4.
moves.18... Re7 19. Bf1 Rae8: Maybe the whole sequence with the idea of doubling the rooks down the e-file is wrong, as after a series of exchanges White could penetrate the 7th rank with his rook.
moves.21... Qa4 22. Qb2: 22. Re1 Rxe1 and 23. Nxe1 would've been very solid
moves.22... Re8 23. Rc1 Rb8 24. Qa2: Black gets come counterplay and pushes White's heavy pieces in the corner.
moves.24... Rb6 25. Bg2:
25. Bg2?
A little too passive, Bh3 or c4 would cause complications
moves.25... Qa5 26. Nh4: I looked at 26...Qxc3 and thought that after 27.Bxd5 Ne5 things were unclear
moves.26... Ne5: The prophylactic 26...Ne5 threw away the initiative
moves.27. Bxd5: 27. Nf5 with the idea of Ne7+ should win the d-pawn with a tempo. (Nxh6? is met with Kh7)
moves.27... Qxc3 28. Bb3:
28. Bb3??
The computer finds a nice winning combination with 28...c4! 29. Bxc4 Ng4!
With all sorts of ideas, but the evaluation is not so clear
This endgame liquidation is slightly better for White but very close to equality
36. ...Ne5 may have gave Black an advantage
